org.orgName: District Court for the Fourth Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: Territory of Washington County of Spokane WeI Charles D. Colwell as principal and ___ and ___ as sureties acknowledge ourselves to be indebted to the Territory of Washington in the sum of one hundred dollars if default be made in the condition following.

The condition of this reconoziance is such that if the above named Charles D Colwell shall be and appear at the Term of the District Court, now holding court on the Monday June 1888 to give evidence touching a bill of Indictment which may be preferred against George Smith. ___as well to be the Grand Jurors who may enquire concerning the same, as to the Court and Jury upon the trial said George Smith and shall not depart the said Court without leave, then this recognizance to be void, otherwise to be and remain in full force and effect. Charles D, Colwell Taken, subscribed and acknowledged before me this 2nd day of June 1888
J.R. Snyder Justice of the Peace

Territory of Washington County of Spokane WeI, C.M. Graves as principal and ___ and ___ as sureties acknowledge ourselves to be indebted to the Territory of Washington in the sum of One Hundred dollars if default be made in the condition following.

The Condition of this reconoziance is such that if the above named C.M. Graves shall be and appear at the Term of the District Court, now holding court on the Monday 1888 to give evidence touching a bill of Indictment which may be preferred against George Smith. ___ as well to the Grand Jurors who may enquire concerning the same, as to the Court and Jury upon the trial said George Smith and shall not depart the said Court without leave, then this recognizance to be void, otherwise to be and remain in full force and effect. C.M. Graves Taken, subscribed and acknowledged before me this 2nd day of June 1888
J.R. Snyder Justice of the Peace

Territory of Washington County of Spokane We I, F.L. Graves as principal and ___ and ___ as sureties acknowledge ourselves to be indebted to the Territory of Washington in the sum of One Hundred dollars if default be made in the condition following.

The Condition of this reconoziance is such that if the above named F.L. Graves shall be and appear at the Tem of the District Court, next to be holden in said County of the June 1888 to give evidence touching a bill of Indictment which may be preferred against George Smith ___ as well to the Grand Jurors who may enquire concerning the same, as to the Court and Jury upon the trial of said George Smith and shall not depart the said Court without leave, then this recongnizance to be void, otherwise to be and remain in full force and effect. F.L. Graves Taken, subscribed and acknowledged before me this 2nd day of June 1888
J.R. Snyder Justice of the Peace
Territory of Washington, County of Spokane

Territory of Washington Plaintiff vs. Geo. Smith Defendant In the District Court of the Territory of Washington, in and for the Fourth Judicial District thereof, holding terms at Spokane Falls, Spokane County, in said Territory.

TO THE SHERIFF OF SPOKANE COUNTY, GREETING: IN THE NAME OF THE UNITED STATES. You are hereby commanded to Summon L. Goldberg to be and appear before the District Court, at the Court House, in Spokane Falls, in said County, on the day of June A.D. 1888, at o'clock to here give evidence in the above entitled cause on part of said Defendant there to remain until discharged. WITNESS the Hon. , Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of Washington Territory, and Judge of said Court, and the Seal thereof affixed, this 7 day of June, A.D. 1888 D.A. Clement, Clerk. By , Deputy

Territory of Washington County of Spokane I hereby certify that I served the within Subpoena on the within named witness by reading the same to in said County, on this 7th day of June A.D. 1888 James Glispin, Sheriff. By ___ Deputy.

Case No. SUBPOENA. In the District Court of the Territory of Washington, in for the Fourth Judicial District thereof holding terms at Spokane Falls, Spokane County, in said Territory. Territory Plaintiff vs. GEO Smith Defendant.
Returned and filed this ___ day of ___A,D. 188_ ___ Clerk. By ___ Deputy.
SHERIFFS FEES. Serving 1 names at 40 40 Mileage 2 miles at 10 20 Total - - - - - - - $60

Territory of Washington, County of Spokane Territory of Washington Plaintiff vs. George Smith Defendant In the District Court of the Territory of Washington, in for the Fourth Judicial District thereof holding terms at Spokane Falls, Spokane County, in said Territory.

TO THE SHERIFF OF Spokane COUNTY, GREETING: IN THE NAME OF THE UNITED STATES, You are hereby commanded to Summon Joseph Deversky (W.A. Hotel) Elisha Davenport at Jacksons 2nd hand store
to be and appear before the District Court, at the Court House, in Spokane Falls, in said County, on the instantes day of June A.D. 1888, at o'clock to here give evidence in the above entitled cause on part of said defendant there to remain until discharged. WITNESS the Hon. , Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of Washington Territory, and Judge of said Court, and the Seal thereof affixed, this 6th day of June A.D. 1888 D.A. Clement, Clerk By ___ B. Johnston, Deputy

Territory of Washington County of Spokane I hereby certify that I served the within Subpoena on the within named witness by reading the same to them in said County, on this 6th day of June A.D. 1888 James Glispin, Sheriff. By JNOMartin, Deputy.

Case No. SUBPOENA In the District Court of the Territory of Washington, and for the Fourth Judicial District thereof holding terms at Spokane Falls, Spokane County, in said Territory Territory Plaintiff. vs, GEO, Smith Defendant.
Returned and filed this ___ day of ___A,D. 188_ ___ Clerk. By ___ Deputy.
SHERIFF FEES. Serving 2 names at 40 .80 Mileage 4 miles at 10 .40 Total - - - - - - $1.20
